alert.note: Alert for Moffat (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 18 at 2:45PM MDT until further notice by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Colorado... Yampa River near Maybell affecting Moffat County. .The combination of warm, spring temperatures and the potential for periods of rain falling on a deep snowpack will lead to an increase in runoff due to snowmelt. Flows in rivers may increase quickly and are expected to remain above bankfull through the weekend, hitting critical stages by early next week. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Yampa River near Maybell. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, The Yampa River reaches bankfull in spots which would result in minor flooding of low-lying agricultural land and some bank erosion. At 11.0 feet, the boat ramp in the Maybell Bridge Campground/Yampa River Access Point becomes flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:15 PM MDT Thursday the stage was 10.5 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate below flood stage with a maximum value of 11.1 feet late Sunday evening. - Action stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm MDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Yampa River Maybell 12.0 10.5 Thu 1 pm MDT 10.6 10.9 11.0 &&
info.instruction: If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
